abstract: Warren E. Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway won approval from European regulators Thursday to buy U.S. company TTI, which distributes electronic components that other companies use to make a range of products. The European Commission cleared the deal automatically after identifying no antitrust problem and receiving no complaints from rivals within a deadline of 25 working days.
lead_paragraph: Warren E. Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway won approval from European regulators Thursday to buy U.S. company TTI, which distributes electronic components that other companies use to make a range of products. The European Commission cleared the deal automatically after identifying no antitrust problem and receiving no complaints from rivals within a deadline of 25 working days.

headline.main: EU Clears Berkshire Deal for TTI
